title: Brit Award viewers think The 1975 were 'hacked' during performance - but fans say this is what really happened
text:

The 1975 may have won Best British Group at the Brits tonight - but the staging of their performance later on was lost on some viewers. 
During their show on stage, messages popped up behind them on screens, prompting some watchers to question if they had been ‘hacked’. 
Messages including insults such as ‘out of tune’ and ‘bland monotone beats’ were displayed behind the band as they belted out one of their hits. The messages appeared on the screen behind the band (Photo: ITV) Read More Bluedot Festival adds more acts to 2017 line up - plus WIN TICKETS 
Some viewers even rushed to social media to question why producers had let the ‘mishap’ happen. 
A confused tweeter wrote: “Did someone just hack the ITV and slag The 1975 off for their whole performance? Surely not part of the plan?” 
But fans of the Manchester band rushed to social media to reveal that the performance was basically ripped straight from the group’s music video, as reported in the Mirror . The 1975 
“PLEASE WATCH THE VIDEO FOR ‘THE SOUND’ BY THE 1975. IT WAS PART OF THE PERFORMANCE. STOP BEING BASIC,” wrote one angry fan. 
Another added: “It is literally from their music video, as if people think they have been hacked smh I cannot” 
And it looks like fans of the band were right all along. The messages displayed during the show were actually criticisms they had received following the release of their debut album. The messages appeared during the performance by The 1975 Read More The 1975 win Best British Group at the BRIT Awards 
It’s understood they featured the insults as a retort to the critics who doubted them when they first started out - before they became one of the biggest bands in the country. 
Despite their detractors, it turned out to be great night for the group this year, as they managed to beat Little Mix to Best British Group. Like us on Facebook
